headline.main: Saudi Arabia to Close Contentious School in Germany
headline.print_headline: Saudi Arabia to Close Contentious School in Germany

docs.snippet: Saudi Arabia is closing a government-sponsored school in Germany that has been the subject of tension in the past....
docs.lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia is closing a government-sponsored school in Germany that has been the subject of tension in the past.

headline.main: Egypt Seeks Tougher Punishment for Female Genital Mutilation
headline.print_headline: Egypt Seeks Tougher Punishment for Female Genital Mutilation

docs.snippet: Women's rights activists hailed the Egyptian government on Monday for advocating increased prison sentences for perpetrators of female genital mutilation (FGM) but warned that a new law could shroud the practice in greater secrecy....
docs.lead_paragraph: Women's rights activists hailed the Egyptian government on Monday for advocating increased prison sentences for perpetrators of female genital mutilation (FGM) but warned that a new law could shroud the practice in greater secrecy.

headline.main: American Businessman McCourt Buying French Club Marseille
headline.print_headline: American Businessman McCourt Buying French Club Marseille

docs.snippet: American businessman Frank McCourt is buying French soccer club Marseille from Russian-born billionaire Margarita Louis-Dreyfus, heralding a new chapter for a team that has fallen into the shadow of bitter rival Paris Saint-Germain....
docs.lead_paragraph: American businessman Frank McCourt is buying French soccer club Marseille from Russian-born billionaire Margarita Louis-Dreyfus, heralding a new chapter for a team that has fallen into the shadow of bitter rival Paris Saint-Germain.

headline.main: FBI Detects Breaches Against Two State Voter Systems
headline.print_headline: FBI Detects Breaches Against Two State Voter Systems

docs.snippet: The Federal Bureau of Investigation has found breaches in Illinois and Arizona's voter registration databases and is urging states to increase computer security ahead of the Nov. 8 presidential election, according to a U.S. official familiar with ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The Federal Bureau of Investigation has found breaches in Illinois and Arizona's voter registration databases and is urging states to increase computer security ahead of the Nov. 8 presidential election, according to a U.S. official familiar with the probe.

headline.main: European Ships Rescue Thousands of Migrants Off Libyan Coast
headline.print_headline: European Ships Rescue Thousands of Migrants Off Libyan Coast

docs.snippet: Italian naval ships and vessels from non-government groups rescued thousands of migrants off the Libyan coast on Monday, the latest surge in desperate attempts to flee to Europe driven by war, poverty, and human traffickers....
docs.lead_paragraph: Italian naval ships and vessels from non-government groups rescued thousands of migrants off the Libyan coast on Monday, the latest surge in desperate attempts to flee to Europe driven by war, poverty, and human traffickers.

headline.main: Chinese, British Energy Officials Discuss Hinkley Point Nuclear Project
headline.print_headline: Chinese, British Energy Officials Discuss Hinkley Point Nuclear Project

docs.snippet: Senior Chinese and British energy officials have met to discuss the Hinkley Point nuclear project after the British government's surprise decision to delay the $24 billion plan upset China, one of the backers of the scheme....
docs.lead_paragraph: Senior Chinese and British energy officials have met to discuss the Hinkley Point nuclear project after the British government's surprise decision to delay the $24 billion plan upset China, one of the backers of the scheme.

docs.snippet: Belgium’s national forensic crime laboratory was set on fire Monday, causing severe damage and potentially destroying crucial evidence. No one was wounded in the attack....
docs.lead_paragraph: Belgium’s national forensic crime laboratory was set on fire Monday, causing severe damage and potentially destroying crucial evidence. No one was wounded in the attack.

headline.main: 2 Arrested in Kenya, Accused of IS Anthrax Attack Plot
headline.print_headline: 2 Arrested in Kenya, Accused of IS Anthrax Attack Plot

docs.snippet: Two people accused of being part of an Islamic State group extremist cell of medics attempting to launch an anthrax attack in the country have been arrested, Kenyan police said Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Two people accused of being part of an Islamic State group extremist cell of medics attempting to launch an anthrax attack in the country have been arrested, Kenyan police said Monday.
